page.syntax: flag as L = session.GetSQLCredentials(BYREF username as c, BYREF password as c)
page.description: Gets current user name and password for SQL connections.
page.discussion: The Session.GetSQLCredentials() Method gets the current user name and password for SQL connections in the current session. Session.SetSQLCredentials() must previously have been called.
page.example:
<%a5 dim UsernameIn as c = "ThisIsMyUsername" dim PasswordIn as c = "ThisIsMyPassword" dim UsernameOut as c = "" dim PasswordOut as c = ""
? "Original username: " + UsernameIn + "
" ? "Original password: " + PasswordIn + "
" ? "
"
if Session.SetSQLCredentials(UsernameIn,PasswordIn) ? "Credentials have been set into the session
" ? "
"
if Session.GetSQLCredentials(UsernameOut,PasswordOut) ? "Retrieved username: " + UsernameOut + "
" ? "Retrieved password: " + PasswordOut+ "
" ? "
"
if (UsernameIn == UsernameOut) .and. (PasswordIn == PasswordOut) then ? "TEST PASSED" else ? "TEST FAILED" end if else ? "Error getting credentials" end if else ? "Error setting credentials" end if %>
